description.narrative:
Shareholders impact: The project is expected to improve access to finance for the MSME sector in LIS, by earmarking the proceeds towards these enterprises. It would also support formal job creation by contributing to improvement in economic activity.
Market Impact: The funding to LIS will enable greater financial inclusion in these states which are the poorest states in the country with significantly low penetration of financial services. In addition, by investing through a relatively nascent market segment of securitization of Non-PSL portfolio where there is low participation of institutional investors, IFC will continue to support market creation for viable market-based funding tools in India.

The proposed project envisages a rupee denominated investment into securitized assets of Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited (STFC or the Company) of US$200 million equivalent. Of the proposed amount, the intention is that 50% of the investment will be achieved through mobilization. The proceeds of the proposed project will help the Company meet its funding requirements and allow it to continue grow its reach to micro, small and medium enterprise (MSME), particularly in the low-income states(LIS) and rural regions of India. STFC is the flagship company of the Shriram Group which was established in 1979 and is listed in the National and Bombay Stock Exchanges. It is registered with the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) as a deposit taking non-banking finance company (NBFC) and is headquartered in Mumbai, India. The Company has over the years expanded its products from financing commercial vehicles (CV) to finance passenger vehicles, tractors, three wheelers, multi-utility vehicles, and to provide ancillary services. As of December 31, 2018, STFC has assets under management (AUM) of INR1,038 billion and reaches 2.0 million customers through 1,348 branches, 885 rural centers and partnership with over 500 private financiers across most Indian states. The Company has an external Credit Rating of CRISIL AA+, CARE AA+, IND AA+, S&P BB+, and Fitch BB+.
